LibSystem Class Reference

This is the main client program for the library system, and handles all user interaction / menus.

#include <LibSystem.h>

Collaboration diagram for LibSystem:

[legend]

Private Attributes

map< string, long > bookMap
 Used for finding an ISBN when you only know the book title.
.
BinarySearchTree< BookType > books
 Stores all the books in the library system, organised into a searchable structure.
.
BinarySearchTree< BookLoan > loans
 Stores all the loans in the library system, organised into a searchable structure.
.
vector< BookLoan > loansVect
 Stores all the loans in the library system, organised in a linear structure.
.
vector< MemberType > usersVect
 Stores all the users in the library system, organised in a linear structure.
.
vector< MemberType >::iterator userIter
 Iterator for traversing the list of library users.
.
bool admin
 Indicates if the current user has admin rights (is a staff member).
.
bool loggedIn
 Indicates if anyone is logged in at the moment.
.
bool running
 Indicates if the library system is running.
.
MemberType currentSysUser
 The user who is currently logged in.
.
string BOOKFILE
 Contains the (relative) file path of the text file for storing all book data.
.
string USERFILE
 Contains the (relative) file path of the text file for storing all user data.
.
string LOANFILE
 Contains the (relative) file path of the text file for storing all loan data.
.
string BOOK_RESTORE_FILE
 Contains the (relative) file path of the text file for storing all BACKUP book data.
.
string USER_RESTORE_FILE
 Contains the (relative) file path of the text file for storing all BACKUP user data.
.
string LOAN_RESTORE_FILE
 Contains the (relative) file path of the text file for storing all BACKUP loan data.

bool LibSystem::init ( const bool  restore  ) 

Init. Arguments: bool

Parameters:
restore (bool) Specify 1 if you want to load the default settings. Otherwise specify false to load the regular settings.
Returns:
bool True if successful.
Wipes current system data and loads data from text files.
